newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech stock market in subdued mood as indices fall.
newsitem.headline: Czech stock market in subdued mood as indices fall.

text.p: The Czech PX50 index posted its sixth straight fall on Tuesday with turnover staying low and dealers seeing little chance of a revival in interest in Czech equities before the Senate elections in mid-November.
The PX50 lost 0.6 percent to 559.7 while the RPIX index of continuously traded shares fell 0.8 percent to 1,114.

Dealers said the malaise in the Czech equities market was typical of the region as a whole, although the current political situation in the Czech Republic was seen as adding further woes to an already subdued bourse.
"I don't see anything really dramatic in the market changing things until the Senate elections," said Ivan Kusacek of Zivnostenska Banka.

Kusacek also said the current situation in the Czech parliament, in which the minority centre-right government is at the mercy of the opposition Social Democrats, was undoubtedly part of the reason for the lack of interest in the stock market.
On the Prague Stock Exchange itself major issues were once again at the forefront of the decline. All major issues except CEZ, which was unchanged, lost ground.
